column4: No menu item `jack' in node `(dir)Top'. this is the uotput i get when do info jack
can we install ubuntu on 128 mb ram
you can, but it might save you time to start with one of the varieties that require less hardware resources, such as Lubuntu
the default mainline Ubuntu environment will be annoyingly demanding
technically yes, but using Lubuntu would be a better idea
the environment would be incredibly unresponsive, it simply is not designed with such old hardware in mind
I can't see how moving from Debian to Ubuntu would be anything but a step backwards
if you want to lighten the load, simply install a window manager or DE lighter than KDE and GNOME
all the commands you need are in the link I gave
